div1.p:
American Consular Service
Bruxelles, le 20, janvier 1908

Monsieur le Secretaire d'Etat de l'Etat Independant du Congo
30, rue de Namur, Bruxelles.
Monsieur,

J'ai l'honneur de vous transmettre ci-joint la copie d'une lettre que nous avons recu de Monsieur Fred. B. Pitney, d'Austin, Nevada, Etats Unis d'Amerique et de vous prier d'avoir l'obligeance de nous donner, si c'est possible, les renseignments demandes.
En vous remerciant d'avance, veuillez agreer, Monsieur, l'assurance de ma parfaite consideration.

Gregory Chelan
Vice Consul-General

Gold Park Mining Company.
Mines Gold Park, Nevada.

Austin, Nevada,
December 4, 1907.

The American Consul
Brussels, Belgium,
Dear Sir;

Captain S. M. Dodd and I have become much interested in the Congo Free State and are contemplating closing up our affairs in Nevada and going to that country, provided it appears that the inducements are sufficient. We would appreciate it very much if you would send us such information as you have concerning the opportunities in the Congo, the advantages the country offers, the business that may be engaged in with profit, such as minig ranching, stock farming, cotton or other planting, etc. We would also, appreciate it, if you would give us any information you may have on the laws governing homestead, timber land, mineral location and other land occupation in the Congo.
If you have not the time or the information at your command, we would be very much obliged to you, if you would refer this letter to some one who would furnish us the information we desire.

Thanking you for the trouble, I am,
Yours very truly,
(signed) Fred. B. Pitney
V.P. and Gen. Mgr. Gold Park Mining Co.
Austin, Lander County, Nevada, U.S.A.

American Consular Service
Brussels, the 29th of January 1908

Mr. Secretary of State of the Independent State of the Congo
30, Namur Street, Brussels.
Sir,

I have the honor to convey this copy of a letter that we received from Mr. Fred. B. Pitney, of Austin, Nevada, United States of America and pray for you to have the kindness to give to us, if it is possible, these detailed requests.
By thanking you in advance, please accept, Sir, the assurance of my perfect consideration.

Gregory Chelan
Vice Consul-General
